data.content:
noun
plural -bons
a narrow piece of cloth (such as silk) that is used to tie things or for decoration [count]
She wore pink ribbons in her hair.
She tied a ribbon around the present. [noncount]
a length/piece of ribbon
The present was tied with ribbon.
[count] :a short piece of cloth that is given as a military award
The soldier proudly wore his ribbons and medals.
[count] chiefly US :a piece of colored cloth that is given as an award in a competition
Her pie won a ribbon at the county fair. - see also blue ribbon
[count] :something that is long and narrow like a strip of cloth
a ribbon of road
[count] :a long and narrow piece of cloth with ink that is used for producing printed characters in a typewriter or printer
ribbons [plural] :narrow pieces of something that has been cut or torn apart
Her pants were torn/cut to ribbons. [=to pieces]

Tính từ
được tô điểm bằng những dải
